data.title: C# Fatal Build Error in CryEngine.Core (Release) (CMake) (5.3.1) (CryMono)
data.body:
Cannot build with c# support in release mode in 5.3.1.

**Offending file:**
`CryEngine.Core/AI/BehaviorTreeNode.cs`

**Offending Lines:**
041. `				_updateContext.behaviorLog.AddMessage(message);`
215. `			context.debugTree.Push(this);`
250. `			context.debugTree.Pop(returnStatus);`

**Cause:**
`USING_BEHAVIOR_TREE_VISUALIZER` is disabled in release which prevents certain methods not being defined and exposed to c# side.

**Possible Solution:**
Create a bool method exposed to c# returning true if tree visualizer is active.
Modify the offending lines to check for this bool by calling the exposed method.
Create an appropriate fall back method for _Log()_ defined in _BehaviorTreeNode.cs_.

**Temporary workaround:**
Disable offending lines in release build.

data.title: CE 5.3.1 Duplication of Geom Entity causes warnings and incorrect bounding box
data.body:
![scene view](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19655175/22400520/d7f00f70-e5b7-11e6-8d4f-49bf9c2c24ec.jpg)
"primitive_cylinder1" is a Geom Entity added to the level like that: "Create Object -> Geom Entity -> ab.cgf"
"primitive_cylinder2" is a duplicate(Ctrl+D) of "primitive_cylinder1"

Bounding Box of "primitive_cylinder2" is incorrect.
After duplication ViewDistRatio of "primitive_cylinder2"(0) wasn't matching ViewDistRatio of "primitive_cylinder1" (100).

Duplication caused following warnings and errors:
![console](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19655175/22400473/2bc621ea-e5b6-11e6-8524-36b27ff12d1f.jpg)

P.S.  Duplication of Geom Entities created in this way:
"Create Object -> Entity -> Geometry -> GeomEntity"
Isn't causing any warnings or errors and ViewDistRatio of duplicates matches ViewDistRatio of original.
However they don't have Bounding Boxes:
![scene view two](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19655175/22400726/6f447d5c-e5bd-11e6-9c92-628ee82bb106.jpg)

data.title: CE 5.3.1 Geom Entity not showing up in game
data.body:
Geom Entities added to the level in this way:
"Create Object -> Geom Entity -> mesh.cgf"
Aren't present in game(LodRatio and ViewDistRatio are set to 255, HiddenInGame isn't enabled, MinSpec is set to "All").

Geom Entities added to the level in this way:
"Create Object -> Entity -> Geometry -> GeomEntity" Are present in game.

P.S.  By "in game" I mean Launch Game from CRYENGINE Launcher or Launch Game from right click menu on ".cryproject" file.

data.title: CE 5.3.1 and 5.3.2 | Gravity Volume causes crash of the Sandbox Editor
data.body:
When switching to game or simulating physics/AI with gravity volume placed in the level, editor crashes.

When creating Gravity Volume following warning shows up in the Console: "Entity creation failed, class AreaBezierVolume was not registered with the engine!"

data.title: download_sdks.py uses wrong URL
data.body:
The download_sdks.py script fails to download the SDKs on Linux. It fails with a 404 error.

$ python3 ./download_sdks.py
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./download_sdks.py", line 74, in <module>
    main()
  File "./download_sdks.py", line 43, in main
    u = request.urlopen(url)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/urllib/request.py", line 163, in urlopen
    return opener.open(url, data, timeout)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/urllib/request.py", line 472, in open
    response = meth(req, response)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/urllib/request.py", line 582, in http_response
    'http', request, response, code, msg, hdrs)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/urllib/request.py", line 510, in error
    return self._call_chain(*args)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/urllib/request.py", line 444, in _call_chain
    result = func(*args)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/urllib/request.py", line 590, in http_error_default
    raise HTTPError(req.full_url, code, msg, hdrs, fp)
urllib.error.HTTPError: HTTP Error 404: Not Found

data.title: cmake create solutions with multiprocessor compilation turned on
data.body: Right now, the solutions generated for vc 2015 have projects in them that have multiprocessor compilation turned off. Could you turn it on by default? Or make an option in cmake for it?

data.title: cmake build directory
data.body: If I use cmake to create a vc 2015 project with multiple build configuration, say debug, profile and release, I can build any of those in from vc. However, it seems as if they all get built to /bin/win_x64. Shouldn't there be a subdirectory for debug, profile and release?

data.title: eshadowsMaxTexRes issues
data.body:
hey guys,
Changing eshadowsMaxTexRes to higher values than 2048 makes the sahdwos kinda bugging out. If you move your player or camera like forward and back of certains objects, shadows start to flicker or even disappear completely.

data.body: vsync, sys_Maxfps console command doesn`t work in editor mode.

data.title: No GI from Pointlights since 5.30
data.body:
hey,
Like the title says, there is no GI from pointlights since Version 5.3... I was hoping that version 5.3.1 would fix this problem but still nothing. Something important like GI, which is a core feature of the engine should be hot fixed instantly. For me and others it's bascially not possible to work on interior lighting since GI is broken.

data.title: C# EntityComponent OnCollision not called
data.body:
The OnCollision function of C# entities is never called. 
I did some testing and
`m_pClass->IsMethodImplemented(pEntityComponentClass, "OnCollision(System.IntPtr, System.IntPtr)"`  in ManagedComponentEntity.cpp on line 40 returns false even though I went ahead and implemented that method inside **CryEngine.Core** (I believe the function `OnCollisionInternal` is supposed to be that). Once I override the check for implementation and add the event bit by hand, my C# entity receives collision events properly.

data.title: Umlaute in Flowgraph
data.body: You cannot use german "umlaute" (äöü...) in flowgraph input-strings. If you use them the level/layer is not loaded correctly anymore.

data.title: (5.3) Glass Shader disabled depending rotation or distance of the object
data.body:
Hi, 

Using the glass shader, it sometimes (depending on the rotation of the camera around the object) disappear in the editor. (contrary to VR mode, the distance doesnt impact the visibility of the shader)

In VR mode, the glass shader disappear on one eye (the left one). This depend on the rotation but  on the distance to the object too
When we go further, the glass shader disappear on both eyes.

I have this issue on two different computer (laptop and desktop using a 960m and a 1080 nvidia graphic card)

regards

Geoffroy

data.title: 5.3 Editor - long level loading
data.body:
After update  we can't make our game level anymore. Because usually it loads just after 5-10 minutes.
One level was borked, just bacause 5 module-houses was loading to long.
By tests - we are sure, that in 5.3 version it depends of objects count in scene. And it's really require some optimization.

Any hot fixes for that? Just impossible to make the game now :(

data.title: Detail Mapping does not work (5.3)
data.body: Detail Mapping option does not working in illum shader (version 5.3). Turning it on not affecting material. Using standart SDK textures (unified approach).

data.title: ESYSTEM_EVENT_3D_POST_RENDERING_START and ESYSTEM_EVENT_3D_POST_RENDERING_END never get fired
data.body:
ESYSTEM_EVENT_3D_POST_RENDERING_START and ESYSTEM_EVENT_3D_POST_RENDERING_END are defined in enum ESystemEvent but searching for them in the whole cryengine code, they never get set. There are however several switch cases which have them as a case. I tried implementing a handler in my CGamePlugin::OnSystemEvent() nevertheless. They never get called.

They would come in handy to use those gEnv->pRenderer->Push2dImage() and similar methods. Right now, I don't know where to call those without such events.

data.title: CE 5.3 r_PostProcessEffects=0 causes improper rendering
data.body:
That's how it looks like when r_PostProcessEffects is set to 0;
![r_postprocesseffects 0 effect](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19655175/22400833/5b5087fc-e5c0-11e6-9d5e-4acb327bac27.jpg)
I think it's doing something like this:

When r_PostProcessEffects=1:
1.Update camera position and rotation.
2.Clear buffer.
3.Render scene to the buffer.
4.Draw helpers on top of the buffer (buffer = buffer + helpers on top of it).
5.Present the buffer to the user.

When r_PostProcessEffects=0:
1.Update camera postion and rotation.
2.Clear wrong_buffer.
2.Render scene to the wrong_buffer (buffer which isn't shown to the user).
3.Draw helpers on top of old_buffer (buffer which was filled before r_PostprocessEffects was set to 0).
4.Present the old_buffer to the user.

//----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Also after setting r_PostProcessEffects to 0 following assert appeared in Console:
"[File=D:/jk/gamesdk_release/Code/CryEngine/RenderDll/XRenderD3D9/../Common/RenderView.cpp]"
(It's visible on the image above).

data.title: [5.3 - 5.3.3] - Can't change locale in game launcher
data.body:
shift + alt combination not work in CE 5.3.0
You need "roll up" window , change locale and back to game/editor

data.title: Print Screen for taking a screenshot to clipboard is globally disabled when a 5.3 game is running
data.body:
When a 5.3 game is running neither print screen or alt + print screen creates a screenshot in the clipboard. The game doesn't have to have focus. Capturing screenshots of other windows from other programms also doesn't work. As soon as you close the game, it works again.

It worked in 5.2 . I asked about this in slack and 2 other people confirmed they can reproduce it. So I thought I post it here.
